glsa.title: PeerCast: Format string vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: PeerCast suffers from a format string vulnerability that could allow arbitrary code execution.

background.p: PeerCast is a media streaming system based on P2P technology.

description.p: James Bercegay of the GulfTech Security Research Team discovered that PeerCast insecurely implements formatted printing when receiving a request with a malformed URL.

impact.p: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a request with a specially crafted URL to a PeerCast server to execute arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All PeerCast users should upgrade to the latest available version:
